{{also|cent|Cent.|cent-}} ==German== ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/(t)sɛnt/}} * {{audio|de|De-Cent.ogg|Audio}} ===Noun=== {{de-noun|m|Cents|Cent|pl2=Cents}} # [[cent]], the smaller unit of the [[euro]] # [[cent]] (in other currencies) ====Usage notes==== The difference between the plurals ''Cent'' and ''Cents'' is equivalent to the difference between [[pence]] and [[pennies]] in English: The unchanged plural refers to an amount or value, whereas ''Cents'' may be used to mean a number of coins. However, the unchanged plural can be used for the latter meaning as well. ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} ---- ==Old English== ===Etymology=== From {{der|ang|la|Cantia}}, from a [[Celtic]] source probably meaning 'border' or 'coastal region'. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|ang|/kent/}} ===Proper noun=== {{ang-proper noun|g=f}} # [[Kent]] ====Declension==== {{ang-decl-noun|type=strong i-stem |Cent| |Cent,Cente| |Cente| |Cente }} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|ang|Cantware}} * {{l|ang|Centisċ}} [[Category:ang:Counties of England]] {{cln|ang|i-stem nouns}}
